articles.title: Polon√™s para Casais: 50+ Frases Essenciais
articles.content:
import VocabCard from '@components/VocabCard.astro';
import CultureTip from '@components/CultureTip.astro';
import PhraseOfDay from '@components/PhraseOfDay.astro';
import CTA from '@components/CTA.astro';

Comunicar-se com seu parceiro polon√™s vai muito al√©m de dizer "eu te amo". O dia a dia de um casal envolve dezenas de pequenas intera√ß√µes que, quando feitas no idioma do seu amor, se tornam ainda mais especiais. Vamos explorar as frases essenciais que todo casal precisa conhecer!

## Cumprimentos do Dia a Dia

<PhraseOfDay
  word="Cze≈õƒá, kochanie!"
  translation="Oi, amor!"
  pronunciation="tch√©shtch, ko-RRA-nie"
  context="O cumprimento informal perfeito para seu parceiro."
/>

### Pela Manh√£

<VocabCard
  word="Dzie≈Ñ dobry, s≈Çoneczko"
  translation="Bom dia, solzinho"
  pronunciation="djien DO-bri, swo-NETCH-ko"
  example="Dzie≈Ñ dobry, s≈Çoneczko. Jak siƒô spa≈Ça≈õ?"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Jak siƒô spa≈Çe≈õ/spa≈Ça≈õ?"
  translation="Como voc√™ dormiu? (masc./fem.)"
  pronunciation="yak sh√™ SPA-wesh/SPA-wash"
  example="Dzie≈Ñ dobry! Jak siƒô spa≈Ça≈õ, kochanie?"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="≈öni≈Çem/≈öni≈Çam o tobie"
  translation="Sonhei com voc√™ (masc./fem.)"
  pronunciation="SHNI-wem/SHNI-wam o TO-bie"
  example="≈öni≈Çem o tobie ca≈ÇƒÖ noc."
/>

### √Ä Noite

<VocabCard
  word="Dobranoc, kochanie"
  translation="Boa noite, amor"
  pronunciation="do-BRA-nots, ko-RRA-nie"
  example="Dobranoc, kochanie. ≈öpij dobrze."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="≈öpij dobrze"
  translation="Durma bem"
  pronunciation="shpiy DOB-je"
  example="Dobranoc, ≈õpij dobrze, moje serce."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="S≈Çodkich sn√≥w"
  translation="Bons sonhos"
  pronunciation="SWOD-kikh snuf"
  example="S≈Çodkich sn√≥w, moja mi≈Ço≈õci."
/>

## Express√µes de Afeto

<CultureTip title="Expressando Carinho na Pol√¥nia" flag="üáµüá±">
Os poloneses s√£o mais reservados em p√∫blico, mas muito carinhosos em privado. N√£o se surpreenda se seu parceiro for t√≠mido para demonstrar afeto na rua, mas muito amoroso em casa. √â uma caracter√≠stica cultural!
</CultureTip>

<VocabCard
  word="Tƒôskniƒô za tobƒÖ"
  translation="Estou com saudades de voc√™"
  pronunciation="TENS-kni√™ za TO-bow"
  example="Ca≈Çy dzie≈Ñ tƒôskniƒô za tobƒÖ."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="My≈õlƒô o tobie"
  translation="Estou pensando em voc√™"
  pronunciation="MISH-l√™ o TO-bie"
  example="CiƒÖgle my≈õlƒô o tobie."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Jeste≈õ cudowny/cudowna"
  translation="Voc√™ √© maravilhoso/maravilhosa"
  pronunciation="YES-tesh tsu-DOV-ni/tsu-DOV-na"
  example="Wiesz co? Jeste≈õ cudowna."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Uwielbiam ciƒô"
  translation="Eu adoro voc√™"
  pronunciation="u-VIEL-byam tch√™"
  example="Uwielbiam ciƒô, kochanie."
/>

## Frases para o Cotidiano

### Fazendo Planos

<VocabCard
  word="Co chcesz robiƒá dzisiaj?"
  translation="O que voc√™ quer fazer hoje?"
  pronunciation="tso khtsesh RO-bitch DJI-shay"
  example="Jest piƒôkna pogoda. Co chcesz robiƒá dzisiaj?"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Chod≈∫my na spacer"
  translation="Vamos dar um passeio"
  pronunciation="KHODJ-mi na SPA-tser"
  example="Pogoda jest ≈Çadna, chod≈∫my na spacer."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Mam pomys≈Ç!"
  translation="Tenho uma ideia!"
  pronunciation="mam po-MISW"
  example="Mam pomys≈Ç! Chod≈∫my do kina."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Zgadzam siƒô"
  translation="Concordo"
  pronunciation="ZGA-dzam sh√™"
  example="To ≈õwietny pomys≈Ç, zgadzam siƒô."
/>

### Demonstrando Cuidado

<VocabCard
  word="Wszystko w porzƒÖdku?"
  translation="Est√° tudo bem?"
  pronunciation="FSHIST-ko v po-ZHOND-ku"
  example="WyglƒÖdasz smutno. Wszystko w porzƒÖdku?"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Jak siƒô czujesz?"
  translation="Como voc√™ est√° se sentindo?"
  pronunciation="yak sh√™ TCHU-yesh"
  example="Jak siƒô czujesz dzisiaj, kochanie?"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Mogƒô ci jako≈õ pom√≥c?"
  translation="Posso te ajudar de alguma forma?"
  pronunciation="MO-g√™ tchi YA-kosh PO-muts"
  example="Widzƒô, ≈ºe jeste≈õ zmƒôczona. Mogƒô ci jako≈õ pom√≥c?"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Jestem tu dla ciebie"
  translation="Estou aqui para voc√™"
  pronunciation="YES-tem tu dla TCHE-bie"
  example="Pamiƒôtaj, zawsze jestem tu dla ciebie."
/>

## Pedindo e Oferecendo

<VocabCard
  word="Proszƒô"
  translation="Por favor / Aqui est√°"
  pronunciation="PRO-sh√™"
  example="Proszƒô, kochanie, zr√≥b to dla mnie."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Dziƒôkujƒô"
  translation="Obrigado/Obrigada"
  pronunciation="dji√™n-KU-y√™"
  example="Dziƒôkujƒô za wszystko, co robisz."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Chcesz herbaty?"
  translation="Quer ch√°?"
  pronunciation="khtsesh her-BA-ti"
  example="Chcesz herbaty? W≈Ça≈õnie robiƒô."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Zrobiƒô ci kawƒô"
  translation="Vou fazer caf√© para voc√™"
  pronunciation="ZRO-bi√™ tchi KA-v√™"
  example="UsiƒÖd≈∫, zrobiƒô ci kawƒô."
/>

## Express√µes de Apoio

<CultureTip title="Apoio Emocional" flag="üáµüá±">
Os poloneses valorizam muito o apoio emocional em relacionamentos. Expressar que voc√™ est√° presente nos momentos dif√≠ceis √© extremamente importante na cultura polonesa.
</CultureTip>

<VocabCard
  word="Wierzƒô w ciebie"
  translation="Acredito em voc√™"
  pronunciation="VIE-j√™ v TCHE-bie"
  example="Dasz radƒô, wierzƒô w ciebie."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Dasz radƒô"
  translation="Voc√™ consegue"
  pronunciation="dash RA-d√™"
  example="To trudne, ale wiem, ≈ºe dasz radƒô."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Jestem z ciebie dumny/dumna"
  translation="Estou orgulhoso/orgulhosa de voc√™"
  pronunciation="YES-tem z TCHE-bie DUM-ni/DUM-na"
  example="≈öwietnie ci posz≈Ço! Jestem z ciebie dumna."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Zawsze bƒôdƒô przy tobie"
  translation="Sempre estarei ao seu lado"
  pronunciation="ZAV-she BEN-d√™ pshi TO-bie"
  example="Niewa≈ºne co siƒô stanie, zawsze bƒôdƒô przy tobie."
/>

## Frases Rom√¢nticas

<VocabCard
  word="WyglƒÖdasz piƒôknie"
  translation="Voc√™ est√° linda/lindo"
  pronunciation="vi-GLON-dash PIENK-nie"
  example="WyglƒÖdasz piƒôknie dzisiaj, kochanie."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Jeste≈õ najwa≈ºniejszƒÖ osobƒÖ w moim ≈ºyciu"
  translation="Voc√™ √© a pessoa mais importante na minha vida"
  pronunciation="YES-tesh nay-vaj-NIEY-show o-SO-bow v MO-im JI-tchu"
  example="Wiesz o tym? Jeste≈õ najwa≈ºniejszƒÖ osobƒÖ w moim ≈ºyciu."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Nie mogƒô siƒô doczekaƒá, ≈ºeby ciƒô zobaczyƒá"
  translation="Mal posso esperar para te ver"
  pronunciation="nie MO-g√™ sh√™ do-TCHE-katch JE-bi tch√™ zo-BA-tchitch"
  example="Wracam do domu! Nie mogƒô siƒô doczekaƒá, ≈ºeby ciƒô zobaczyƒá."
/>

## Tabela de Refer√™ncia R√°pida

| Polon√™s | Portugu√™s | Quando Usar |
|---------|-----------|-------------|
| Cze≈õƒá! | Oi! | Cumprimento casual |
| Kocham ciƒô | Eu te amo | Declara√ß√£o de amor |
| Tƒôskniƒô za tobƒÖ | Sinto sua falta | Quando est√£o separados |
| Przepraszam | Desculpa | Para pedir perd√£o |
| Dziƒôkujƒô | Obrigado/a | Agradecer |
| Proszƒô | Por favor | Pedir algo |
| Dobranoc | Boa noite | Ao dormir |
| Dzie≈Ñ dobry | Bom dia | Pela manh√£ |
| Jak siƒô masz? | Como voc√™ est√°? | Perguntar sobre bem-estar |
| Wszystko dobrze | Tudo bem | Responder que est√° bem |

## Frases para Resolver Conflitos

<VocabCard
  word="Przepraszam"
  translation="Desculpa / Sinto muito"
  pronunciation="pshe-PRA-sham"
  example="Przepraszam, nie chcia≈Çem ciƒô zraniƒá."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Nie chcia≈Çem/am ciƒô zraniƒá"
  translation="N√£o queria te machucar"
  pronunciation="nie KHCHA-wem/am tch√™ ZRA-nitch"
  example="Przepraszam, naprawdƒô nie chcia≈Çem ciƒô zraniƒá."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Mo≈ºemy porozmawiaƒá?"
  translation="Podemos conversar?"
  pronunciation="MO-je-mi po-roz-MA-viatch"
  example="Proszƒô, mo≈ºemy porozmawiaƒá o tym?"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Wybaczam ci"
  translation="Eu te perdoo"
  pronunciation="vi-BA-tcham tchi"
  example="Wiem, ≈ºe nie chcia≈Çe≈õ. Wybaczam ci."
/>

## Dicas de Pron√∫ncia

O polon√™s tem alguns sons desafiadores para falantes de portugu√™s:

1. **ƒÜ, ≈ö, ≈π** - Sons suaves, com a l√≠ngua no c√©u da boca
2. **CZ, SZ, ≈ª/RZ** - Sons mais fortes e "duros"
3. **≈Å** - Soa como "U" em portugu√™s
4. **ƒÑ, ƒò** - Vogais nasais, similares ao portugu√™s!

<CTA
  text="Pronto para melhorar a comunica√ß√£o com seu parceiro? Love Languages oferece Modo Escuta para jantares em fam√≠lia, o Love Log para salvar frases especiais, e a possibilidade do seu parceiro criar desafios personalizados como tutor."
  buttonText="Come√ßar Gr√°tis"
/>

articles.title: Swedish Emotional Support Phrases: Comfort Your Partner in Difficult Times
articles.content:
When your Swedish-speaking partner faces difficult times, offering comfort in their native language shows genuine care. Swedish sincerity makes it perfect for meaningful support.

## Phrases of Presence

**Jag finns h√§r f√∂r dig**
*(Yag fins hair fur dey)*
*I'm here for you*

**Du √§r inte ensam i det h√§r**
*You're not alone in this*

**Du kan alltid r√§kna med mig**
*You can always count on me*

## Expressing Empathy

**Jag f√∂rst√•r vad du g√•r igenom**
*I understand what you're going through*

**Det √§r helt normalt att k√§nna s√•**
*It's completely normal to feel this way*

**Dina k√§nslor √§r helt ber√§ttigade**
*Your feelings are completely valid*

## Offering Comfort

**Allt kommer att ordna sig**
*Everything will work out*

**Tillsammans klarar vi det h√§r**
*Together we'll manage this*

**Jag √§r s√• stolt √∂ver dig**
*I'm so proud of you*

## Active Support

**Vad kan jag g√∂ra f√∂r att hj√§lpa dig?**
*What can I do to help you?*

**Vill du prata om det eller vara tysta tillsammans?**
*Do you want to talk about it or be quiet together?*

**Ber√§tta vad du beh√∂ver**
*Tell me what you need*

## Specific Situations

### Grief
**Jag √§r s√• ledsen f√∂r din f√∂rlust**
*I'm so sorry for your loss*

### Stress
**Andas med mig**
*Breathe with me*

**Vi tar det steg f√∂r steg**
*We'll take it step by step*

### Disappointment
**Jag vet hur mycket det h√§r betydde f√∂r dig**
*I know how much this meant to you*

**Du beh√∂ver inte alltid vara stark**
*You don't always have to be strong*

## Physical Comfort

**Kom hit, l√•t mig h√•lla om dig**
*Come here, let me hold you*

## Encouragement

**Du √§r starkare √§n du tror**
*You're stronger than you think*

**Jag tror p√• dig**
*I believe in you*

## Being Present

**Du beh√∂ver inte s√§ga n√•gonting**
*You don't have to say anything*

**Jag vill bara vara h√§r med dig**
*I just want to be here with you*

Sincere Swedish support shows genuine care.

articles.title: Frases en Portugu√©s para Reconciliarte con tu Pareja
articles.content:
El portugu√©s tiene una dulzura especial para expresar amor y arrepentimiento. Si tu pareja habla portugu√©s, estas frases te ayudar√°n a sanar cualquier conflicto de manera sincera.

## La Reconciliaci√≥n en Portugu√©s

Tanto brasile√±os como portugueses valoran las expresiones sinceras de afecto. Una disculpa genuina acompa√±ada de cari√±o f√≠sico es muy apreciada.

## Frases para Pedir Disculpas

### "Desculpa pelo que eu disse"
**Pronunciaci√≥n:** Des-CUL-pa PE-lo que eu DI-se

**Significado:** Perdona por lo que dije

Una disculpa directa y sincera.

### "Eu n√£o queria te magoar"
**Pronunciaci√≥n:** Eu nao que-RI-a te ma-go-AR

**Significado:** No quer√≠a herirte

Aclara tus intenciones.

### "Podemos come√ßar de novo?"
**Pronunciaci√≥n:** Po-DE-mos co-me-SAR de NO-vo

**Significado:** ¬øPodemos empezar de nuevo?

Propone un nuevo comienzo.

### "Eu estava errado/a"
**Pronunciaci√≥n:** Eu es-TA-va e-RA-do/a

**Significado:** Estuve mal / Me equivoqu√©

Admitir errores con humildad.

## Frases para Expresar Amor Despu√©s del Conflicto

### "Eu te amo, mesmo quando brigamos"
**Pronunciaci√≥n:** Eu te A-mo MES-mo CUAN-do bri-GA-mos

**Significado:** Te amo, incluso cuando peleamos

Reafirma el amor a pesar de los conflictos.

### "Voc√™ significa tudo pra mim"
**Pronunciaci√≥n:** Vo-SE sig-ni-FI-ca TU-do pra mim

**Significado:** Significas todo para m√≠

Expresa la importancia de tu pareja.

### "Eu odeio brigar com voc√™"
**Pronunciaci√≥n:** Eu o-DEI-o bri-GAR com vo-SE

**Significado:** Odio pelear contigo

Prefieres la armon√≠a.

## Frases para Reconstruir la Conexi√≥n

### "Vamos conversar com calma"
**Pronunciaci√≥n:** VA-mos con-ver-SAR com CAL-ma

**Significado:** Habl√©moslo con calma

Invita a una conversaci√≥n profunda.

### "Quero te entender melhor"
**Pronunciaci√≥n:** QUE-ro te en-ten-DER me-LIOR

**Significado:** Quiero entenderte mejor

Muestra disposici√≥n a mejorar.

### "O que posso fazer para consertar isso?"
**Pronunciaci√≥n:** O que PO-so fa-ZER PA-ra con-ser-TAR I-so

**Significado:** ¬øQu√© puedo hacer para arreglarlo?

Ofrece reparar el da√±o.

### "Prometo me esfor√ßar mais"
**Pronunciaci√≥n:** Pro-ME-to me es-for-SAR mais

**Significado:** Prometo esforzarme m√°s

Compromiso de mejorar.

### "Posso te abra√ßar?"
**Pronunciaci√≥n:** PO-so te a-bra-SAR

**Significado:** ¬øPuedo abrazarte?

El contacto f√≠sico sana heridas.

## Diferencias Brasil vs Portugal

Los brasile√±os tienden a ser m√°s expresivos y cari√±osos en las reconciliaciones, mientras que los portugueses pueden ser m√°s reservados pero igualmente sinceros.

## Conclusi√≥n

El portugu√©s te permite expresar arrepentimiento y amor de manera profunda. Usa estas frases para reconectar con tu pareja lus√≥fona.

sections: ## Frases para Expresar Amor Despu√©s del Conflicto

articles.title: Russian Arguing & Disagreement Phrases for English Speakers
articles.content:
Russian relationships can be intensely emotional, and disagreements are no exception. When you're with a Russian speaker, knowing how to express yourself during conflicts in their language demonstrates deep commitment. Here are essential Russian phrases for navigating difficult conversations.

## Expressing Disagreement

### –Ø –Ω–µ —Å–æ–≥–ª–∞—Å–µ–Ω / –Ø –Ω–µ —Å–æ–≥–ª–∞—Å–Ω–∞
**Transliteration:** Ya ne soglAsen / Ya ne soglAsna

**Meaning:** "I don't agree" or "I disagree"

**When to use it:** The direct way to express disagreement. Use "—Å–æ–≥–ª–∞—Å–µ–Ω" if you're male, "—Å–æ–≥–ª–∞—Å–Ω–∞" if you're female.

**Example:** "–Ø –Ω–µ —Å–æ–≥–ª–∞—Å–µ–Ω —Å —Ç–µ–º, —á—Ç–æ —Ç—ã —Å–∫–∞–∑–∞–ª." (I don't agree with what you said.)

### –≠—Ç–æ –Ω–µ—Å–ø—Ä–∞–≤–µ–¥–ª–∏–≤–æ
**Transliteration:** Eto nespravedlIvo

**Meaning:** "That's not fair"

**When to use it:** When something feels inequitable or unjust.

### –¢—ã –º–µ–Ω—è –Ω–µ–ø—Ä–∞–≤–∏–ª—å–Ω–æ –ø–æ–Ω–∏–º–∞–µ—à—å
**Transliteration:** Ty menyA neprAvilno ponimAesh

**Meaning:** "You're misunderstanding me"

**When to use it:** When your words or intentions are being misread.

### –¢—ã –º–µ–Ω—è –Ω–µ —Å–ª—É—à–∞–µ—à—å
**Transliteration:** Ty menyA ne slUshayesh

**Meaning:** "You're not listening to me"

**When to use it:** When you feel unheard during an argument.

## Expressing Frustration

### –Ø —Ä–∞—Å—Å—Ç—Ä–æ–µ–Ω / –Ø —Ä–∞—Å—Å—Ç—Ä–æ–µ–Ω–∞
**Transliteration:** Ya rastrOyen / Ya rastrOyena

**Meaning:** "I'm upset"

**When to use it:** To express emotional distress. Use masculine or feminine ending as appropriate.

### –ú–µ–Ω—è —Ä–∞–∑–¥—Ä–∞–∂–∞–µ—Ç, –∫–æ–≥–¥–∞...
**Transliteration:** MenyA razdrazhAyet, kogdA

**Meaning:** "It irritates me when..."

**When to use it:** To express specific behaviors that bother you.

**Example:** "–ú–µ–Ω—è —Ä–∞–∑–¥—Ä–∞–∂–∞–µ—Ç, –∫–æ–≥–¥–∞ —Ç—ã –æ–ø–∞–∑–¥—ã–≤–∞–µ—à—å." (It irritates me when you're late.)

### –ú–Ω–µ –Ω—É–∂–Ω–æ –≤—Ä–µ–º—è
**Transliteration:** Mne nUzhno vrEmya

**Meaning:** "I need time"

**When to use it:** When you need to step away and calm down.

### –≠—Ç–æ –º–µ–Ω—è —Ä–∞–Ω–∏—Ç
**Transliteration:** Eto menyA rAnit

**Meaning:** "That hurts me"

**When to use it:** To express emotional pain caused by your partner's words or actions.

## Setting Boundaries

### –ù–µ –≥–æ–≤–æ—Ä–∏ —Å–æ –º–Ω–æ–π —Ç–∞–∫
**Transliteration:** Ne govorI so mnoy tak

**Meaning:** "Don't talk to me like that"

**When to use it:** When the tone becomes disrespectful.

### –≠—Ç–æ —Å–ª–∏—à–∫–æ–º
**Transliteration:** Eto slIshkom

**Meaning:** "That's too much"

**When to use it:** When something crosses a line.

### –î–∞–≤–∞–π –ø–æ–≥–æ–≤–æ—Ä–∏–º —Å–ø–æ–∫–æ–π–Ω–æ
**Transliteration:** DavAy pogovorIm spokOyno

**Meaning:** "Let's talk calmly"

**When to use it:** To de-escalate a heated argument.

## Seeking Resolution

### –ú—ã –º–æ–∂–µ–º –Ω–∞–π—Ç–∏ —Ä–µ—à–µ–Ω–∏–µ –≤–º–µ—Å—Ç–µ?
**Transliteration:** My mOzhem naytI reshEniye vmEste?

**Meaning:** "Can we find a solution together?"

**When to use it:** When ready to work toward resolution.

### –Ø —Ö–æ—á—É —Ç–µ–±—è –ø–æ–Ω—è—Ç—å
**Transliteration:** Ya hochU tebyA ponyAt

**Meaning:** "I want to understand you"

**When to use it:** To show genuine interest in your partner's perspective.

### –ß—Ç–æ –º—ã –º–æ–∂–µ–º —Å–¥–µ–ª–∞—Ç—å?
**Transliteration:** Shto my mOzhem sdElat?

**Meaning:** "What can we do?"

**When to use it:** To shift from argument to problem-solving.

## Cultural Considerations

Russian communication can be more emotionally expressive than typical English-speaking cultures. Passionate disagreements don't necessarily signal the end‚Äîthey often mean both people care deeply.

Always use "—Ç—ã" (informal you) with your partner. Using "–≤—ã" (formal) would create painful distance and suggest something is seriously wrong with the relationship itself.

In Russian culture, fully resolving an argument often matters more than quickly moving past it. Your partner may want to discuss issues thoroughly. Making up often involves heartfelt conversation, physical affection, and sometimes small gifts or gestures.

Saying "–ü—Ä–æ—Å—Ç–∏ –º–µ–Ω—è" (Forgive me) or "–Ø —Ç–µ–±—è –ª—é–±–ª—é" (I love you) after resolving conflict carries deep emotional significance.

## Practice for Real Situations

Learn these phrases during peaceful times so they're available when needed. Your Russian-speaking partner will appreciate your effort to navigate difficult emotions in their language‚Äîit shows your commitment to understanding them fully.
